comments.text:
Created attachment 522156
screenshot @ 120 DPI

To reproduce:
1-adjust default font prefs suitably for high DPI environment
2-open about:addons without zoom or minimum font size enabled

Actual results:
1-as screenshot shows, most text is a tiny fraction of UI (size CSS menu) and other app text (mostly 10pt), and an even smaller fraction of the browser's default size setting (20px/4.2333mozmm)

Expected results:
1-most text is legibly and politely equal to the Firefox default proportional font size setting

Notes:
1-at 20px Firefox default, approximately 5 zoom increments are required to get the dominant text size up to default, which causes a substantial horizontal scroll despite ample horizontal padding/whitespace
2-setting minimum font size to 85% of default causes virtually all text in the page to be the same size, as well as partially or completely disappear
3-120 DPI isn't particularly high any more, and quite common on the more expensive laptops
